intro: Monochaetum carazoi, commonly known as the Carazoi grass, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
